course_description: Define the clinical relevance and practical application of the following fundamental principles of medical ethics: Beneficence, Non-Maleficence, Patient Autonomy, Justice. Utilize the "Four Quadrant Model",  to articulate one's reasoning in making ethically-informed medial decisions, identify areas specific to the role of being a medical student that may present ethical conflicts, and determine the decision-making capacity of patients to give informed consent for medical care.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1103, Section #: 2024, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: Kinlaw/Phipps, Status: Closed
